page.title: 03LANDSCAPE OF DACRE.
page.content: The landscape of Dacre is predominatly grassland much of it pasture suitable for cattle grazing and on the higher valley slopes rougher grass suited to sheep rearing.The river Dacre runs through the bottom of the steep sided and fairly narrow valley with the village nestling at the valley floor. There is little evidence of cultivated land except for some flatter valley tops where turnips and some barley grow.The flatter grassland fields are intensly farmed for silage and hay for winter feed of the dairy herds and cattle kept on local farms.The rough landscape is patchworked and patterned by a mixture of decidious and ever green woodland and some of the highest land to the south is moor and fell pasture.The view from Dacre Bank reveals a landscape unchanged for centuries.
